subject: RE: [junit] printing my own debug messages
msgSnippet: i did not find Syslog...where can i find it? ... From: Francois Beausoleil [mailto:fbos44@hotmail.com] Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 9:05 AM To:
messageBody:
i did not find Syslog...where can i find it?
-----Original Message-----
From: Francois Beausoleil [mailto:fbos44@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 9:05 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] printing my own debug messages

Personnaly, I prefer Syslog from www.clarkware.com.  JavaWorld (www.javaworld.com) had an article about best practices for it.
 
What I like about Syslog (although I have not used Log4J very much) is that I can start logging with just a line.  The default values are fine for me - Output goes to the console.
 
The only problem I have with that is that the results of the output are not mixed with the results of the TestCase.  So, if I have lots of debugging messages, the output is not with the failure.  I have to work a bit to make it fit.  But it's usually paid off by finding another error or two :)
 
Thanks,
Francois
----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Rogers
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 9:34 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] printing my own debug messages

I looked at that some time ago for some simple logging needs we had, and it
seemed really heavyweight.  Do you disagree?  Do you think it can be scaled
down pretty easily?

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Andrew Clarke [mailto:andrew.clarke@...]
    > Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 9:07 AM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: RE: [junit] printing my own debug messages
    >
    >
    > Why not use another great piece of freeware, log4j?  
    > This can be downloaded
    > from the Apache site.
    >
    > rgds, APC
    >
    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: steinbeck@... [mailto:steinbeck@...]
    > Sent: 03 July 2001 14:01
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: [junit] printing my own debug messages
    >
    >
    > Hi there,
    >
    > I've check all the available documentation on whether there is a
    > possibility to print my own debug output messages from a
    > test case in
    > a controlled way - ideally I would like to get them in a
    > "results.txt" like can be produced by the junit task in
    > ant. It seems
    > that this is not the way that I'm supposed to go, since
    > there seems to
    > be no option for that.
    >
    > Nevertheless, it would be nice to use the test case for debugging
    > (until it works).
    > It there an option for that?
    >
    > Cheers,
    >
    > Chris
    >
